title: Type is invalid. You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in
body: I posted a [SO question](https://stackoverflow.com/q/50055552/1270459) and created an [issue on the Voyager project](https://github.com/vega/voyager/issues/798) but thought I'd also document it here. I'm using components from [Voyager](https://github.com/vega/voyager) which uses React 15. I have the following error: ``` Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in. Check the render method of DataSelectorBase. Uncaught Error: Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined. You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in. Check the render method of DataSelectorBase. ``` I know in most cases this error implies `import`/`export` problems but I don't think there's anything wrong with how [`LoadData`](https://github.com/vega/voyager/blob/master/src/components/load-data-pane/index.tsx#L37) and [`DataSelector`](https://github.com/vega/voyager/blob/master/src/components/data-selector/index.tsx#L272) are exported in Voyager. I also believe I imported `DataSelector` right: ``` import { LoadData } from 'datavoyager/build/components/load-data-pane/index'; ``` The most weird thing is that when I `npm link` to the same version of Voyager locally, I don't get this error, but when I use the released version, the error shows up?!
